Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Mop \Mop\, n. [CF. W. mop, mopa, Ir. moipal, Gael. moibeal, moibean; or OF. mappe a napkin (see {Map}, {Napkin}).] 1. An implement for washing floors, or the like, made of a piece of cloth, or a collection of thrums, or coarse yarn, fastened to a handle. [1913 Webster]
2. A fair where servants are hired. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]
3. The young of any animal; also, a young girl; a moppet. [Prov. Eng.] --Halliwell. [1913 Webster]
{Mop head}. (a) The end of a mop, to which the thrums or rags are fastened. (b) A clamp for holding the thrums or rags of a mop. [U.S.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mop \Mop\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Mopped}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Mopping}.] To rub or wipe with a mop, or as with a mop; as, to mop a floor; to mop one's face with a handkerchief. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mop \Mop\, n. [See {Mope}.] A made-up face; a grimace. ``What mops and mowes it makes!'' --Beau. & Fl. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mop \Mop\, v. i. To make a wry mouth. [Obs.] --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)
Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)
Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: mop n : cleaning implement consisting of absorbent material fastened to a handle; for cleaning floors [syn: {swab}, {swob}] v 1: to wash or wipe with or as if with a mop; "Mop the hallway now"; "He mopped her forehead with a towel" [syn: {wipe up}, {mop up}] 2: make a sad face and thrust out one's lower lip; "mop and mow"; "The girl pouted" [syn: {pout}, {mow}] [also: {mopping}, {mopped}]
